Only available with certain permissions.

@hideFromDocumentation

fields.description: Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: charts

Only available with certain permissions.

args.description: The date of the charts to pull.

args.name: category
args.description: Which category charts to pull.

args.name: country
args.description: The country the charts are for. Expected in 2-character country code, such as us or ca.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Creator
types.description: The creator object and all of its attributes.

fields.name: pcid
fields.description: The public Podchaser ID of the creator

fields.name: name
fields.description: The full name of the creator

fields.name: informalName
fields.description: A shorter, informal version of the creator's name

fields.name: pronouns
fields.description: The pronouns used to refer to the creator

fields.name: subtitleShort
fields.description: Auto-generated subtitle based on the top credit for the creator.

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description: Auto-generated subtitle based on the top 3 credits for the creator.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Location of the creator, if provided by creator.

fields.name: bio
fields.description: Creator's bio as added by creator.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL for the creator's page on Podchaser

fields.name: birthday
fields.description: Birthday of the creator, if provided by creator.

fields.name: imageUrl
fields.description: The creator's image within Podchaser.

fields.name: modifiedDate
fields.description: When the creator entity was last updated within Podchaser.

fields.name: socialLinks
fields.description: The social media handles for the creator.

fields.name: followerCount
fields.description: The number of users who follow the creator.

fields.name: episodeAppearanceCount
fields.description: The number of episodes the creator has appeared on.

fields.name: credits
fields.description: All of the credits for the creator.

args.name: first
args.description: Limits number of fetched elements. Maximum allowed value: 100.

args.name: page
args.description: The offset from which elements are returned.

args.name: searchTerm
args.description: A search term to filter on.

args.name: sort
args.description: How to sort the results

types.name: Url
types.description: A valid URL that can be resolved

types.name: Date
types.description: A date string with format `Y-m-d`, e.g. `2011-05-23`.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: A datetime string with format `Y-m-d H:i:s`, e.g. `2018-05-23 13:43:32`.

types.name: CreatorSocialLinks
types.description: The social media handles for a creator.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: CreditFilters
types.description: Filters that can be applied to a credits query.

inputFields.name: role
inputFields.description: Filter by a creator's role. See Podcast Taxonomy for options

inputFields.name: modifiedDate
inputFields.description: Filter by the time period that any of the data within Podchaser was added or updated for a credit.

types.name: Sort
types.description: Desired sort for a list

types.name: SortType
types.description: The attribute to sort the list on.

types.name: SortDirection
types.description:
Which direction to sort the list by.

Note: some sort options will only allow a single direction.

types.name: PodcastCreditList
types.description: A paginated list of PodcastCredit items.

fields.name: paginatorInfo
fields.description: Pagination information about the list of items.

fields.name: data
fields.description: A list of PodcastCredit items.

types.name: PaginatorInfo
types.description: Information about pagination using a fully featured paginator.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number of items in the current page.

fields.name: currentPage
fields.description: Index of the current page.

fields.name: firstItem
fields.description: Index of the first item in the current page.

fields.name: hasMorePages
fields.description: Are there more pages after this one?

fields.name: lastItem
fields.description: Index of the last item in the current page.

fields.name: lastPage
fields.description: Index of the last available page.

fields.name: perPage
fields.description: Number of items per page.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Number of total available items.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: PodcastCredit
types.description: A podcast-level credit representing a unique role of a unique creator who is attached to one or more episodes of a podcast.

fields.name: podcast
fields.description: The podcast and all its data.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: The creator and all their data.

fields.name: role
fields.description: What role they had within the episode, such as host, guest, producer, and many others.

fields.name: modifiedDate
fields.description: The date the credit was last updated or was added.

fields.name: episodeCount
fields.description: The number of episodes this creator was in this role for the podcast.

fields.name: episodeCredits
fields.description: The individual episode-level credits for each episode this creator was in this role for.

args.description: Limits number of fetched elements. Maximum allowed value: 100.

types.name: Podcast
types.description: The podcast object and all of its attributes.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Podchaser's internal podcast ID.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the podcast as specified in the RSS feed or podcast platform.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A string only representation of the podcast description.

fields.name: sanitizedDescription
fields.description: A processed version of the podcast description including sanitized HTML.

fields.name: htmlDescription
fields.description: A processed version of the podcast description including sanitized HTML.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL for the podcast on Podchaser.

fields.name: webUrl
fields.description: The homepage for the podcast as specified in the RSS feed.

fields.name: rssUrl
fields.description: The URL of the primary RSS feed for the podcast. This may be null if the podcast source is Spotify or another service.

fields.name: imageUrl
fields.description: The podcast artwork URL as specified in the RSS feed or podcast platform.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The spoken language of the podcast in standard IETF format.

fields.name: modifiedDate
fields.description: When the podcast entity was last updated within Podchaser.

fields.name: numberOfEpisodes
fields.description: The total number of episodes this podcast has.

fields.name: avgEpisodeLength
fields.description: The average length, in seconds, for this podcast's episodes.

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: When the podcast's first episode aired.

fields.name: socialLinks
fields.description: The social media handles for the podcast.

fields.name: categories
fields.description: All of the Podchaser categories of the podcast.

fields.name: feeds
fields.description: The known feeds for this podcast - this may include feeds from other services and previous inactive RSS feed URLs

fields.name: userRating
fields.description:
The existing rating for the authenticated user 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: userReview
fields.description:
The existing review for the authenticated user 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: ratingAverage
fields.description: The raw un-weighted average of all ratings for this podcast

fields.name: ratingSummary
fields.description:
A summary of how many ratings per star rating for this podcast 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: applePodcastsId
fields.description: The Apple Podcast ID (formerly iTunes ID). This field is either added when the podcast is submitted to Podchaser or Podchaser retrieves this ID after the podcast is approved by moderation team.

fields.name: author
fields.description: The author of the podcast as defined in the RSS feed.

fields.name: itunesAuthor
fields.description: The author of the podcast as defined in the RSS feed.

fields.name: powerScore
fields.description:
The podcast's PowerScore, which is Podchaser's unique attribute that represents how popular and influential a podcast is. Calculated using a proprietary algorithm which uses dozens of different factors, such as reach and subcribers. Requires Plus or Pro API access.  

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: audienceEstimate
fields.description:
The estimated monthly listens the podcast receives. Requires Plus or Pro API access. 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: contacts
fields.description:
A list of contact information for people related to the podcast. Requires Plus or Pro API access.  

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: demographics
fields.description:
An aggregation of the demographics of the podcast's audience. 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: episodes
fields.description: All the podcast's episodes.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: List
types.description: A user list which can contain podcasts, episodes, headers, and notes.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The name of the list.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description added by the user.

fields.name: privacy
fields.description: What privacy setting the user selected for the list.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL for the list on Podchaser

fields.name: followerCount
fields.description: The number of users who follow the list.

fields.name: likeCount
fields.description: The number of likes the list has received from users.

fields.name: owners
fields.description: The user(s) who can edit the list.

fields.name: episode
fields.description: The episode and all its data.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: The creator and all their data.

fields.name: role

fields.name: characters
fields.description: If the creator was a voice actor, what character they played within the episode.

types.name: ContactRelation

inputFields.description: Expected in 2-character country code, such as us or ca.

inputFields.name: rating

inputFields.description: Filter by the Podchaser categories attached to the podcast. Must search using the 'slug' of the category.

inputFields.description: Filter by the date that any of the data within Podchaser was updated for a podcast.

inputFields.name: powerScore
inputFields.description: Filter by the podcast's PowerScore.

inputFields.name: minRating
inputFields.description: Min rating must be between 1 and 5

inputFields.name: maxRating
inputFields.description: Min rating must be between 1 and 5

fields.name: addCreator
fields.description:
Add a new creator into the Podchaser database 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: editCreator
fields.description:
Make changes to an existing Creator. If the associated user did not submit or has not claimed the creator, this will throw an error 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: addCreditToEpisodes
fields.description:
Add credits for a creator to a selection of episodes 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: removeCreditFromEpisodes
fields.description:
Remove credits for a creator from a selection of episodes 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: removeCharacterFromEpisodes
fields.description:
Remove a character from a selection of episodes that have a voice actor or similar role 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: addRecurringCredit
fields.description:
Add a recurring credit - this creator and role will be added to all new episodes of the podcast 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: removeRecurringCredit
fields.description:
Remove a recurring credit - this will not remove credits from any existing episodes, but new episodes will no longer have this creator and role added 

Only available with certain permissions.

fields.name: submitPodcast
fields.description:
Submit a podcast to the Podchaser database. 

Only available with certain permissions.

args.name: identifier
args.description:
A valid feed identifier. Currently supported are

- RSS Feed URL
- Apple Podcasts ID
- Spotify ID

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The creator's full name

inputFields.name: informalName
inputFields.description: The creator's informal name to be used in casual sentences, usually the first name

inputFields.name: pronouns

inputFields.name: location

inputFields.name: birthday
inputFields.description: The creator's date of birth

inputFields.name: profileImage

inputFields.name: twitter
inputFields.description: The full URL of the creator's Twitter profile

inputFields.name: wikipedia
inputFields.description: The full URL of a Wikipedia article about the creator

types.name: EpisodeSelection

enumValues.name: DATE_RANGE

fields.name: submitted
fields.description: Returns true if the feed submitted resulted in a new podcast being created

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the podcast submitted

fields.name: podcast
fields.description: The podcast that was submitted - this may not contain all episodes or meta data until a full parse process has completed.

inputFields.name: code
inputFields.description: Only required when using authorization_token grant type

inputFields.name: redirect_uri
inputFields.description: Must match the redirect URI set up with Podchaser. Only required when using authorization_token grant type

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: DateTimeTz
types.description: A datetime and timezone string in ISO 8601 format `Y-m-dTH:i:sO`, e.g. `2020-04-20T13:53:12+02:00`.

types.name: OrderByClause
types.description: Allows ordering a list of records.

inputFields.name: column
inputFields.description: The column that is used for ordering.

inputFields.name: order
inputFields.description: The direction that is used for ordering.

types.name: SimplePaginatorInfo
types.description: Information about pagination using a simple paginator.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number of items in the current page.

fields.name: currentPage
fields.description: Index of the current page.

fields.name: firstItem
fields.description: Index of the first item in the current page.

fields.name: lastItem
fields.description: Index of the last item in the current page.

fields.name: perPage
fields.description: Number of items per page.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination using a Relay style cursor connection.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: When paginating forwards, are there more items?

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: The cursor to continue paginating backwards.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: The cursor to continue paginating forwards.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of nodes in the paginated connection.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number of nodes in the current page.

fields.name: currentPage
fields.description: Index of the current page.

fields.name: lastPage
fields.description: Index of the last available page.

types.name: Trashed
types.description: Specify if you want to include or exclude trashed results from a query.

enumValues.name: ONLY
enumValues.description: Only return trashed results.

enumValues.name: WITH
enumValues.description: Return both trashed and non-trashed results.

enumValues.name: WITHOUT
enumValues.description: Only return non-trashed results.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
